result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Chappie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Huber privileges for work.

miscConds.notes:
- Court restitution at zero. 
- Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges. 
- All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment. 
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

- No possession of firearms. 
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.

- probation monitoring by the mental health unit. 
- mental health assessment and folly any recommended treatment. 
- medication with a valid prescription.

- AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. 
- Absolute sobriety with random testing.

timeConds.notes: - 30 Days condition in the HOC with Huber for work imposed and stayed to be used at the PO agents discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Chappie

defendant.name: Chappie, Mark A

records.addlTxt:
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 120 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 18 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- 30 days condition in the HOC with huber for work imposed and stayed to be used at the PO agents discretion.
- no possession of firearms
- probation monitoring by the mental health unit
- mental health assessment and follow any recommended treatment
- AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- medication with a valid prescription

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

Appeal rights given

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Mark A Chappie in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduled plea and sentencing hearing.  Attorney Rauch's motion to withdraw on defendant's request heard and granted.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of counsel.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to counsel.  Court allows self representation by the defendant.  Case paused to allow defendant to review case with ADA McClure.
to withdraw as counsel, Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Mark A Chappie in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Pecora unable to appear as he is unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening. Court previously picked a date with Attorney Pecora's office.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from Attorney Pecora informing court he is unable to attend 5/26/22 hearing, received and filed

Defendant Mark A Chappie in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast. Defense has received discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Mark A Chappie in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
